archdesc.bioghist: Papers of the family of Charles M. Cleveland, grocer and general merchant in Adrian, Michigan.
archdesc.scopecontent: Diaries containing comments on his school days, marriage, life in Adrian, Michigan, weather, current events (particularly the Civil War), business interests, and personal reflections on life; include mention of the trial and failure of the Atlantic cable, the Mormon "War", Election of 1876, and a balloon ascension at Adrian, in 1851; also photographs, three notebooks, an account book, and an autobiographical account, and papers and publications of Edgar F. Cleveland and George H. Cleveland, a Chicago physician.

Portraits of family members and a composite group portrait of the State Inspector of Illuminating Oils and his deputies, 1883.
